main.name: Josh Carter
main.description: I am a software engineer and a people person at heart.  I am mobile app development focused (iOS and Android) and primarily work on client requested apps.  I always give 110% to any problem and always have a "knock-it-out" attitude.  I'm always looking at a process or product and trying to make it more streamlined and simple.
main.bio: Love my wife and two sons | Huge Auburn sports fan | Huge Braves fan | Appreciate a good video game | League Bowler (~200 book average)
main.contactmessage: If you would like to get in touch with me, please reach out! "The man who asks a stupid question is a fool for a minute. The man who does not ask a stupid question is a fool for life."

resume.skillmessage: I have many skills that are focused around mobile app development, app design, and management.  I would never say I am 100% efficient in any skill as there is always the ability to learn more.

education.description: Completed my bachelors at Auburn University while working part time in mobile app development from Sophomore to Senior year.  Also received a Cooperative Education Diploma while working 4 alternating semesters.

work.title: Engineering Manager, Mobile Software
work.description:
- Lead a team of developers to help create an app of high quality and to satisfy the client’s specifications
- Lead development and implementation of new features to be used throughout all apps - Coordinate and participate in the implementation, testing, and support of Android and iOS native applications - Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions. - Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle. - Involved in the hiring and training process

work.title: Lead iOS Developer
work.description:
- Lead a team of developers to help create an app of high quality and for the buyer’s specifications
- Lead development and implementation of new features to be used throughout all apps
- Coordinate and participate in the implementation, testing, and support of iOS-based applications
- Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions.
- Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle.

work.title: iOS Developer
work.description:
- Help develop apps with a team to a high quality level for the buyer’s specifications
- Coordinate and participate in the implementation, testing, and support of iOS-based applications
- Assist in testing all applications against software and hardware versions.
- Provide timely turnaround and documentation of bug fixes during test cycle.

work.title: IT Co-Op
work.years: Fall Semester 2012, Summer Semester 2013, Spring Semester 2014, and Fall Semester 2014
work.description: Provided 1st level support and knowledge involving all hardware and software including workstations, laptops, servers, thin clients, and more.

testimonials.text: Do or Do Not, There is No Try.
